newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan AOC optimistic about Saudi drilling rights.
newsitem.headline: Japan AOC optimistic about Saudi drilling rights.

text.p: Arabian Oil Co Ltd (AOC) of Japan said on Friday it was optimistic about talks with Saudi Arabia on the renewal of drilling rights for a concession in oil fields near the Saudi-Kuwaiti border.

"The atmosphere (between Saudi Arabia and AOC) is very good. We would like to start talks over details on the extension of drilling rights as soon as possible," AOC president Keiichi Konaga told reporters.
"There are no obstacles blocking an agreement," he said.
AOC's concession with Saudi Arabia expires in 2000.
AOC currently produces about 282,000 barrels per day (bpd) of crude oil, mainly from two offshore fields near the Neutral Zone between Saudi Arabia and Kuwait.
About 70 percent of the crude is exported to Japan.
Kuwait has already agreed in principle to renew AOC's drilling rights, which were due to expire in 2003, for another 30 years.
The Saudi and Kuwaiti governments each have a 10.9 percent stake in AOC.
